facts.1: Corn Flakes were invented to discourage masturbation.
facts.2: The first manufactured breakfast cereal had to be soaked overnight before serving.
facts.4: Children in the '70s had red poop from eating Franken Berry Cereal.
facts.5: Cereal is a type of grass cultivated for its grain, which is actually a type of fruit.
facts.6: Corn Flakes was the first cereal to offer a box prize.
facts.7: Colonial families ate popcorn like breakfast cereal.
facts.8: Since Lucky Charms hit grocery shelves in 1964, the pink heart marshmallow is the only original shape to survive changes over the years.
facts.9: There is as much sugar in a serving of Honey Smacks cereal as there is in a glazed doughnut at Dunkin.
facts.10: Astronauts ate Kellogg's Corn Flakes aboard Apollo 11, the first moon landing.
facts.11: Rice Krispies mascots Snap, Crackle and Pop briefly had a fourth brother named Pow in early 1950.
facts.12: The word 'cereal' comes from the ancient Greek word 'Cerealia', a major festival celebrating Ceres, the goddess of agriculture.
facts.13: Tony the Tiger competed against three other mascots for the spot as the Kellogg's Frosted Flakes mascot.
facts.14: Since rice and wheat do not have the built-in casing like corn does to trap steam and make it 'pop,' cereal maker Quaker Oats faced a challenge when they came up with the idea to make cereal out of rice and wheat. Their efforts led them to get hold of an old canon from the Spanish-American war to use as a pressure cooker to put the puff in their puffed cereals.
facts.15: Mascots look downwards on cereal boxes, as marketing teams have realized making eye contact promotes trust in a brand. The cereal mascots look into kid's eyes in order to cause whining and begging for their parents to buy it.
facts.16: Cap'n Crunch is actually a Commander, and not a captain. Captains usually have four stripes and note three.
facts.17: In 1987, General Mills came under fire from Jewish groups after using an enhanced image of Bela Lugosi as Dracula on the box. Many thought it looked like he was wearing a Star of David, making the mascot appear to be some sort of blood-sucking Jewish monster.
facts.18: Honey Smacks have more sugar than a Twinkie.
facts.19: Kellogg's itself has confirmed that the colors in froot loops only represent only a single sugary flavor.
